parameters: \af[2]\n<\N[2]>This pot here looks like it might have some oil in it we can use.
<c:0,60,25>I don't think I'm going to make it
\n<Jackson>\N[1], you're alive. We're being sieged...\. The garden is in ruins.
\n<Jackson>I...\.I don't think I'm going to make it. Find \N[4], he ran into the dungeons to escape.
\n<\N[2]>He's dead, we'll need his gear to survive much longer.
\af[2]\n<\N[2]>Don't be such a baby, here, take these!
\n<\N[2]>Don't mention it. Now we NEED to find \N[4]!
The floor around this block look almost mechanical.
\af[2]\n<\N[2]>Of course! Now I can stab enemies twice as many times.
\N<Skill>\n[2] has learned the "Dual Attack". With two daggers equipped she can unleash with both blades, hitting targets twice in a row with increased critical chance.
Some sort of piston is holding this block up.
The floor around this block look almost mechanical.
\af[1]\n<\N[1]>Maybe Gus escaped, maybe he climbed out.
\af[2]\n<\N[2]>I've seen things like this before. There's some complex mechanism keeping it locked.
\af[2]\n<\N[2]>Hmm, it sounds like you're actually enjoying yourself.
\af[1]\n<\N[1]>Hmph... no, I just haven't swung a sword since leaving the service.
\af[2]\n<\N[2]>Well, it looks like they'll be a lot more swinging to come so be ready. Remember what I told you about the lantern.
\af[1]\n<\N[1]>We can roll this rock if we push together.
\af[2]\n<\N[2]>Sounds like something shifted in the next room.
\af[1]\n<\N[1]>I'm not sure but we need to get out of here, let me help you up.
\N[2] joined your party! \N[2] is a \ac[2], that means they're adept at stealing from enemies and using small blades.
\n<\N[2]>I still have that delicious bread you made and some stew. I think it might help me heal.
Give a bread to \N[2] so they may consume it in order to recover their health points.
\af[2]\n<\N[2]>You can say that again, this dead bat looks like a pickaxe had been driven into it.
You've found a small skeleton key.
The bat is torn to pieces.
\af[1]\n<\N[1]>Wait, something is caught in it's wing.
\af[2]\n<\N[2]>Wait! These dungeons are dangerous and it's extremely dark down here.
\af[2]\n<\N[2]>Watch out! I can smell a goblin up ahead.
\af[2]\n<\N[2]>I didn't think goblins had come this far south, I guess that's what Jackson was trying to tell us.
\af[2]\n<\N[2]>I don't know if we can handle an enemy like that yet but I bet we can grab something useful from him if we're quiet enough.
\af[1]\n<\N[1]>Huh?! You mean like pick his pockets, \N[2], I'm not sure I have the dexterity...
This dead goblin almost looks... sunburned.
This one didn't fare too well.
\af[2]\n<\N[2]>That shield looks helpful! With that you should be able to keep us both safe.

\N<Skill>\n[1] has learned the "Guard" and "Taunting Guard" skills. Guarding reduces damage recieved for a set amount of turns. Taunting Guard, additionally, forces enemies to focus on you for the duration.
\af[2]\n<\N[2]>We should keep exploring, there must be a key somewhere in this place.
\af[2]\n<\N[2]>I'm not sure, I've never seen something like this before, I think it's magic.
\af[1]\n<\N[1]>I've never seen magic before, I've only heard tales of it, why is it here?
\af[2]\n<\N[2]>How should I know? All I know right now is that we need to get out of here, something isn't right.
Very rarely in your adventures you may run across magical runes. Little is known about these symbols but their energies are said to have mystical powers.
Party fully healed, the light from the rune is dissipating.
\af[2]\n<\N[2]>Look at this platform in front of us, this must have been what shifted.
\af[1]\n<\N[1]>Maybe there's something to rolling these stones.
\af[2]\n<\N[2]>Hmm, it sounds like you're actually enjoying yourself.
\af[1]\n<\N[1]>Look, I don't know how that slime was moving but if it's magic then whatever's happening here can't be good.
\af[2]\n<\N[2]>Agreed, this must be more than a regular attack. Something big is happening here.
\af[1]\n<\N[1]>We should keep moving, we need to get out of these dark dungeons.

Enemies sometimes wander in plain sight, allowing you to avoid them if you don't get too close. These creatures are generally territorial and will guard a particular location. They usually won't chase too far.
The one up ahead doesn't seem like it's moving though, so you have no choice but to engage it to continue through the dungeon.
\af[1]\n<\N[1]>It's blocking our path, we'll have to kill it.
\af[2]\n<\N[2]>Good thing that magical rune just healed us.
